item.title: Two experts in Election and Parliamentary Reform (Cat I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The global objective is to assist the EU Delegation in the preparation of detailed designs of two programmes 2017-2020 in support of democratisation: 1) electoral reforms, and 2) parliamentary reforms.

The specific objectives are:

  • Study the sectors context, conduct stakeholder analysis and assess feasibility.
  • Conduct multi-stakeholder consultations to obtain a consensus and good level of ownership from all relevant counterparts for the future programmes.
  • Advise on possible modalities of assistance acceptable to beneficiaries.
  • Develop full set of draft programming documents required for the project identification, formulation and contracting for two programmes (1. electoral reforms, and 2. parliamentary reforms).

Two Experts in Election and Parliamentary Reform (Cat I)

  • Master degree in one or more of the following fields: social or political sciences, law, public administration or any other relevant discipline. If an expert does not hold a master degree, then as an equivalent he must possess the first university degree and 3 years of relevant general professional experience in excess of the 12 years defined below.
  • Each of the experts must possess a minimum of 12 years of professional experience in the sector directly related to the LOT and specifically in democratisation processes, electoral and parliamentary reforms.

  • The two experts need to possess as a minimum a complementary experience and expertise to cover all the following fields:

  • development work in relation to democratisation, electoral reforms, electoral process, election management, in parliamentary support, capacity building and inclusion of media and civil society in elections related activities;

  • programming of the budget support modalities, development of the EU programming documents such as identification fiches, action documents and all the related annexes, policy analysis;

  • contemporary approaches to democracy, the key challenges and achievements to date;

  • good knowledge of Pakistan political landscape including the functioning of the democratic institutions, the framework in which they operate, the relation between the federal and provincial level, rules, procedures, powers and functions, political parties and of the functioning of the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP);

  • cooperation with donors, international organisations, public administrations and civil society in the sector.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Junior Sectorial Expert -Rule of Law and Fundamental Rights
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The general objective of this mission is to assist the EUD in its IPA II programming support function towards the NIPAC and sector lead institutions with the aim to advance sector-based programming and to systematically improve the quality of related programming documents.

The specific objective is to support the EUD in the review of IPA II sector approach assessment criteria and in the work towards finalisation of related Sector Planning Documents, Sector Approach Roadmaps and Action Documents in line with the established templates.

Expert 3:Junior Sectorial Expert -Rule of Law and Fundamental Rights

Education:

  • at least Master’s Degree Academic level in public administration, political science, law or another field relevant to the assignment.

  • Excellent command of English, both spoken and written;

  • For at least one of the junior experts very good knowledge of Turkish, at a level sufficient to read and analyse strategic documents;

  • Computer literacy (MS Office applications);

  • At least 3 years' experience in working on at least one of the sectors Judiciary, Fundamental Rights and Home Affairs;

  • Previous working experience on assignments in Turkey;

  • Professional experience on sector-based programming of EU assistance is considered an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Junior Expert in Events Organisation (fluent in Mandarin and English)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
PSF Arts and Society in China and the EU

The global objective of this mission is to promote a better understanding of EU’s and Chinese policies, provide an exchange platform for artists and increase knowledge about the EU’s work on human rights.

The specific objective is to work in the organisation of five exhibitions in Beijing. Every exhibition will have a different focus topic in line with the EU’s human rights priorities and will be linked to a panel discussion/ round table. The exhibitions will feature Chinese and European artists, encouraging reflection among target audiences and increasing the reach of EU messages through cooperation with local and European artists.

Junior Expert in Events Organisation (fluent in Mandarin and English)

The junior expert will have the overall responsibility for the coordination and logistics, ensuring meeting deadlines, quality, consistency and appropriate content of the outcomes. The expert should have a high proficiency in Mandarin (spoken, written and comprehension). These requirements cannot be replaced in the offer by calling on the services of an interpreter/translator.

The junior expert will have the overall responsibility for the coordination and logistics, ensuring meeting deadlines, quality, consistency and appropriate content of the outcomes. The expert should have a high proficiency in Mandarin (spoken, written and comprehension). These requirements cannot be replaced in the offer by calling on the services of an interpreter/translator.

Qualification and skills:

Education at the level of Masters' Degree in a field related to the content of the project.

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 3 years of professional experience in planning and organizing similar events in China (proven experience in the organization of conferences, exhibitions, etc.).
  • A minimum of two projects involving, embassies or international organizations on similar events.
  • Knowledge of the Chinese economic, political and social system.
  • Proven reporting skills.
  • Proven track record of fluency in Chinese and English.
  • Knowledge of European policies will be considered an advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert in Academic Cooperation and Seminar Organisation
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
PSF EU-China Competition Cooperation

The aim of the project is to contribute to the process of convergence between the EU and China in the area of competition policy and will involve the organization of:

  • Three EU-China Competition Weeks (CW)
  • Two Competition Summer School (CSS) programmes for Chinese officials, and
  • Three Competition Visitors' programmes (CVP) for Chinese officials in Europe

Expert III: CSS Team Leader

The CSS Team Leader will advise DG Competition on the preparation and execution of the CSS and have the overall responsibility for the coordination and management of the team of experts carrying out the assignment as described in these Terms of Reference, providing logistical arrangements, meeting deadlines and ensuring consistency, quality and appropriate content of the outcomes. He or she needs to be attentive to details. The CSS Team Leader will also interact with the beneficiary authorities and supervise the overall delivery of the CSS.

*Qualification and skills *

  • Education at the level of Bachelors' degree. Masters' Degree considered an advantage.

General professional experience

  • At least 10 years' experience in various disciplines related to academic cooperation, conference and seminar organisation.

Specific professional experience

  • At least three relevant assignments preparing and managing international courses, seminars or conferences with foreign authorities.
  • Knowledge of cross cutting issues in economic and competition field. Experience as a legal practitioner and/or academic researcher in the field of competition issues, in particular, with research experiences on comparative analysis from both European and Chinese perspectives
  • Knowledge of developments in the field of competition in China will be considered an asset;
  • Excellent communication skills in both oral and written form in English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Liaison Officer
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
PSF EU-China Competition Cooperation

The aim of the project is to contribute to the process of convergence between the EU and China in the area of competition policy and will involve the organization of:

  • Three EU-China Competition Weeks (CW)
  • Two Competition Summer School (CSS) programmes for Chinese officials, and
  • Three Competition Visitors' programmes (CVP) for Chinese officials in Europe

Expert II: CW Senior Liaison Expert

The CW Liaison Expert as described in section 2.3. will assist the TL in the regular contacts and negotiation with the Chinese authorities regarding the design, content and participation of officials in the CW. It will work under the mandate and in coordination of DG Competition

Qualification and skills

  • Education at the level of Masters' Degree in in economics, law or other relevant discipline; General professional experience
  • At least 10 years' experience in various disciplines in the field of Competition Law.

Specific professional experience

  • Knowledge of cross cutting issues in economic and competition field. Experience as a legal practitioner and/or academic researcher in the field of competition issues, in particular, with research experiences on comparative analysis from both European and Chinese perspectives
  • At least three relevant assignments in the field of competition in China.
  • Knowledge of developments in the field of competition in China is essential,
  • Fluent in Mandarin (mother tongue equivalent),
  • Diplomatic skills and capability of finding compromises which can be turned into actionable outcomes.
  • Excellent drafting and presentation skills in both Chinese and English.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

item.title: Senior Expert in Competition Law (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
PSF EU-China Competition Cooperation

The aim of the project is to contribute to the process of convergence between the EU and China in the area of competition policy and will involve the organization of:

  • Three EU-China Competition Weeks (CW)
  • Two Competition Summer School (CSS) programmes for Chinese officials, and
  • Three Competition Visitors' programmes (CVP) for Chinese officials in Europe

*Expert I: CW Team Leader *

The CW Team Leader will advise DG Competition on the preparation and execution of the CW and have the overall responsibility for the coordination and management of the team of experts carrying out the assignment as described in these Terms of Reference, ensuring meeting deadlines, quality, consistency and appropriate content of the outcomes. He or she needs to be attentive to details. The CW Team Leader will also interact with the beneficiary authorities and moderate the CW in English.

Qualification and skills:

  • Education at the level of Masters' Degree in in economics, law or other relevant discipline;

General professional experience:

  • At least 10 years' experience in various disciplines in the field of Competition Law, preferably with a European Member State Competition authority and/or multilateral organisation and/or working on international cooperation;

Specific professional experience:

  • Wide knowledge of the challenges facing competition regimes in establishing institutional, regulations for enforcement from a European perspective;
  • Experience in providing expert advice to competition agencies, national/regional governmental bodies and multinational business on competition policy and structural reform (at least three relevant assignments).
  • Knowledge of developments in the field of competition in China;
  • Experience in leading and coordinating international teams in capacity building actions (at least three relevant assignments);
  • Excellent drafting and presentation skills in English.

item.title: Senior Expert on Equipment for the Purposes of Border Control of Persons
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Pre-feasibility Study for projects to be possibly funded under the Eastern Partnership Integrated Border Management Flagship Initiative

To facilitate preparation of action document for financing four projects concerning integrated border management at the Moldova-Ukraine border.

Senior Expert on Equipment for the Purposes of Border Control of Persons

Qualifications and skills:

  • Master’s degree in a field related to the assignment (border management, law enforcement), or specialised diploma from police/military academy, or equivalent professional experience of 4 years in border management or law enforcement in addition to the general professional experience required below;
  • Excellent English communication skills, both spoken and written;
  • Good command of Russian will be an advantage.

General professional experience:

Specific professional experience:

  • at least 3 years of experience in developing and/or procuring soft and hardware for national databases/IT systems to support the exchange of information (including real time information transfer, secure communication link) between border agencies in the same country and between agencies of neighbouring countries.

item.title: Three Senior Climate Change Experts
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mainstreaming Climate Change within the EUD in Turkey

The objective of the assignment is to ensure better management and monitoring of the EU funds via safeguarding compliance with the relevant EU climate action priorities and to increase the value added created by the EU financial assistance in Turkey through mainstreaming on climate action within the EU Delegation for the second period of IPA 2014-2020.

Three Senior Climate Change Experts

With expertise on:

  • Development and/or review and/or assessment of planning documents on climate action
  • Development of guidelines on screening/mainstreaming climate change into policy and planning documents
  • Setting up indicator based monitoring and evaluation schemes at project and program levels on climate change
  • Experience in results and/or outcome based evaluations of climate change projects and programmes
  • Existing monitoring and evaluation schemes that are internationally acknowledged e.g. UNFCC, GEF, UN, EU
  • Long-term EU and international climate policies and practices

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert in Property Rights and Property Legislation in Kosovo or Region
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation of the Project: Support to Civil Code and Property Rights

Provide an overall independent assessment of the project “Support to Civil Code and Property Rights” (IPA/2014/344-574), paying particularly attention to sustainability of results and impact of the project and develop in a participatory process key lessons and recommendations for future EU support and the overall reforms.

Expert in Property Rights and Property Legislation in Kosovo or Region

Qualification and skills:

  • A degree in Law, international public law, property law, bar exam or other relevant;
  • strong command of written and spoken English and Albanian, Serbian language skills are considered an asset,

General Professional experience:

  • Minimum 6 years of experience as legal professional, judge and/or academic working on issues related the area of property rights and property legislation, such experience acquired in Kosovo or a country with a comparable legislative environment in the region is considered a strong asset.

Specific Professional Experience:

  • Experience in evaluation of at least one project in the field of property rights related reforms. This must be evidenced by at least one report in English language co-authored by the expert and to be submitted as part of the offer,
  • Experience in working on evaluation of international donor funded projects in relation to property rights reform in Kosovo or a country with a comparable legislative environment in the region is considered a strong asset (this experience would need to be evidenced by submission of at least one relevant report as part of the offer).

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

Provide an overall independent assessment of the project “Support to Civil Code and Property Rights” (IPA/2014/344-574), paying particularly attention to sustainability of results and impact of the project and develop in a participatory process key lessons and recommendations for future EU support and the overall reforms.

item.title: Expert en monitoring des medias en période de campagne électorale (cat. I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
L'objectif générale de la mission est de contribuer au bon déroulement, dans un climat apaisé et dans des conditions de transparence, des élections processus électoral (élections locales, législatives et présidentielle) qui vont se tenir au Niger au cours du premier semestre 2016.

L’objectif particulier c’est appuyer le Conseil Supérieur de la Communication dans sa mission d’évaluation de la ouverture, par les médias, de la campagne électorale lors des élections législatives et présidentielle ainsi que de l'environnement médiatique global.

Expert en monitoring des medias en période de campagne électorale (cat. I)

  • Diplôme universitaire niveau Master ou équivalent en sciences sociales, politiques, juridiques, de la communication ou équivalent un une expérience professionnelle équivalent d’au moins 15 ans;
  • 15 Ans d'expérience prouvée en matière de monitoring des médias en période électorale, d'analyse qualitative des contenus des médias, de rédaction de rapport de monitoring, de formation des journalistes;
  • 10 ans d'expérience dans la gestion d'une équipe de monitoring des médias en période de campagne électorale au sein d'une mission d'observation électorale ou d'un autre organe indépendant de monitoring des médias ;
  • L'expert apportera la preuve de sa familiarité avec les différents systèmes électoraux existants et avec les normes internationales en matière électorale ;
  • Il doit avoir des aptitudes à travailler en équipe et sous pression ;
  • Une expérience en Afrique subsaharienne sera considérée un atout ;
  • La connaissance des procédures FED et de la gestion du cycle du projet est un atout ;
  • Maitrise de la langue française et connaissance de base de l'anglais.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS
